justification: The Methods section states that "participants completed well-established complex span tasks, the operation span (OSpan) task ... to measure individual differences in working memory capacity."
The article notes that "participants completed well-established complex span tasks, the ... symmetry span (SymSpan) task 85 to measure individual differences in working memory capacity."

The authors explain that strategy success was expected to relate to "the habitual deployment of similar strategies to regulate emotions, as measured by the Emotion Regulation Questionnaire, Reappraisal subscale."

Under Individual Difference Measures the paper reports "participant scores for habitual use of ... expressive suppression" obtained from "the 10-item Emotion Regulation Questionnaire (ERQ) ... to assess individual differences in the habitual use of cognitive reappraisal and suppression."

measured_by: temporally structured risky monetary gambling task
justification: Throughout the study the primary dependent variable was risk choice: "We combined a temporally structured risky monetary decision-making task ... Participants made 131 choices between a risky gamble and a guaranteed alternative," making this task the measure of risk-taking behaviour.
